intro: Alpinia branderhorstii, commonly known as the Brandehorst ginger, is a tropical flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related species. The plant features tall, narrow leaves and produces fragrant, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, spicy aroma. Alpinia branderhorstii thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade.
